content.raw: Er, what PR should we be using now?
content.html: Er, what PR should we be using now?

update.description:
This is the prototype branch, that is still a work in progress. I have already split out much of the code from this branch and will split out a few more before this is done.

Implements the following proposal:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal

I've unmarked this as `[Citadel]` since the necessary changes have been made in other pull requests. This branch shows what is left over.
update.title: WIP: frame semantics -> libsdformat9

content.raw: this branch just has the KinematicGraph and a few other things, so let's just close this out and try that another time
content.html: this branch just has the KinematicGraph and a few other things, so let's just close this out and try that another time

content.raw:
I just realized that the `build*Graph` functions already have the output as the left-most argument, so the API is inconsistent in that regard. I'll make the change you suggested, so that output arguments are first and eliminate the unnecessary overload using a default argument value.

I've started doing this in eebed88 and 10255bb
content.html:
I just realized that the build*Graph functions already have the output as the left-most argument, so the API is inconsistent in that regard. I'll make the change you suggested, so that output arguments are first and eliminate the unnecessary overload using a default argument value.

I've started doing this in eebed88 and 10255bb

content.raw:
~~~
$ ign sdf --check extra_heavy_duty_table_surface_only_collision.sdf 
Error: relative_to name[world] specified by frame with name[top_center] does not match a link, joint, or frame name in model with name[extra_heavy_duty_table_surface_only_collision].
~~~
content.html:
$ ign sdf --check extra_heavy_duty_table_surface_only_collision.sdf 
Error: relative_to name[world] specified by frame with name[top_center] does not match a link, joint, or frame name in model with name[extra_heavy_duty_table_surface_only_collision].

content.raw: in 2df412d, I updated some error messages and made sure to throw errors from graph building during `Model::Load` that were previously ignored. I think this should help
